blocks.name: ecase13d
blocks.content: Deduction for elimination by cases. (Contributed by Jeff Hankins, 18-Aug-2009.)
blocks.origin:
thm ecase13d(wff w0, wff w1, wff w2, wff w3) {
  |- wi(w0, w1)
  -| wi(w0, wn(w2))
  -| wi(w0, wn(w3))
  -| wi(w0, w3o(w2, w1, w3))
} = {
  mpd(w0, w1, wn(w3))
  sylib(w0, wi(wn(w3), w1), wo(w1, w3))
  mpd(w0, wo(w1, w3), wn(w2))
  sylib(w0, wi(wn(w2), wo(w1, w3)), w3o(w2, w1, w3))
  bitri(w3o(w2, w1, w3), wi(wn(w2), wo(w1, w3)), wo(w2, wo(w1, w3)))
  3orass(w2, w1, w3)
  df-or(w2, wo(w1, w3))
  bitri(wo(w1, w3), wi(wn(w3), w1), wo(w3, w1))
  orcom(w1, w3)
  df-or(w3, w1)
}

blocks.name: subtr
blocks.content: Transitivity of implicit substitution. (Contributed by Jeff Hankins, 13-Sep-2009.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 11-Dec-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm subtr(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wi(wceq(c0, c2), wceq(c4, c5)))
  -| wnfc(s0, c0)
  -| wnfc(s0, c2)
  -| wnfc(s0, c4)
  -| wnfc(s0, c5)
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wceq(c6, c4))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), c2), wceq(c6, c5))
} = {
  adantr(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3), wi(wceq(c0, c2), wceq(c4, c5)))
  vtoclgf(s0, c0, c1, wi(wceq(c0, c2), wceq(c4, c5)), wi(wceq(cv(s0), c2), wceq(c6, c5)))
  nfim(s0, wceq(c0, c2), wceq(c4, c5))
  nfeq(s0, c0, c2)
  nfeq(s0, c4, c5)
  imbi12d(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wceq(cv(s0), c2), wceq(c6, c5), wceq(c0, c2), wceq(c4, c5))
  eqeq1(cv(s0), c0, c2)
  eqeq1d(c6, c5, c4, wceq(cv(s0), c0))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm subtr(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ c1 ∧ c2 ∈ c3)→(c0 = c2 → c4 = c5))
  ⊣ F/(s0, c0)
  ⊣ F/(s0, c2)
  ⊣ F/(s0, c4)
  ⊣ F/(s0, c5)
  ⊣ (s0 = c0 → c6 = c4)
  ⊣ (s0 = c2 → c6 = c5)
} = {
  adantr(c0 ∈ c1, c2 ∈ c3, (c0 = c2 → c4 = c5))
  vtoclgf(s0, c0, c1, (c0 = c2 → c4 = c5), (s0 = c2 → c6 = c5))
  nfim(s0, c0 = c2, c4 = c5)
  nfeq(s0, c0, c2)
  nfeq(s0, c4, c5)
  imbi12d(s0 = c0, s0 = c2, c6 = c5, c0 = c2, c4 = c5)
  eqeq1(s0, c0, c2)
  eqeq1d(c6, c5, c4, s0 = c0)
}

blocks.name: subtr2
blocks.content: Transitivity of implicit substitution into a wff. (Contributed by Jeff Hankins, 19-Sep-2009.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 11-Dec-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm subtr2(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wi(wceq(c0, c2), wb(w0, w1)))
  -| wnfc(s0, c0)
  -| wnfc(s0, c2)
  -| wnf(s0, w0)
  -| wnf(s0, w1)
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wb(w2, w0))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), c2), wb(w2, w1))
} = {
  adantr(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3), wi(wceq(c0, c2), wb(w0, w1)))
  vtoclgf(s0, c0, c1, wi(wceq(c0, c2), wb(w0, w1)), wi(wceq(cv(s0), c2), wb(w2, w1)))
  nfim(s0, wceq(c0, c2), wb(w0, w1))
  nfeq(s0, c0, c2)
  nfbi(s0, w0, w1)
  imbi12d(wceq(cv(s0), c0), wceq(cv(s0), c2), wb(w2, w1), wceq(c0, c2), wb(w0, w1))
  eqeq1(cv(s0), c0, c2)
  bibi1d(wceq(cv(s0), c0), w2, w1, w0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm subtr2(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ c1 ∧ c2 ∈ c3)→(c0 = c2 →(w0 ↔ w1)))
  ⊣ F/(s0, c0)
  ⊣ F/(s0, c2)
  ⊣ F/(s0, w0)
  ⊣ F/(s0, w1)
  ⊣ (s0 = c0 →(w2 ↔ w0))
  ⊣ (s0 = c2 →(w2 ↔ w1))
} = {
  adantr(c0 ∈ c1, c2 ∈ c3, (c0 = c2 →(w0 ↔ w1)))
  vtoclgf(s0, c0, c1, (c0 = c2 →(w0 ↔ w1)), (s0 = c2 →(w2 ↔ w1)))
  nfim(s0, c0 = c2, (w0 ↔ w1))
  nfeq(s0, c0, c2)
  nfbi(s0, w0, w1)
  imbi12d(s0 = c0, s0 = c2, (w2 ↔ w1), c0 = c2, (w0 ↔ w1))
  eqeq1(s0, c0, c2)
  bibi1d(s0 = c0, w2, w1, w0)
}

blocks.name: elicc3
blocks.content: An equivalent membership condition for closed intervals. (Contributed by Jeff Hankins, 14-Jul-2009.)

blocks.name: finminlem
blocks.content: A useful lemma about finite sets. If a property holds for a finite set, it holds for a minimal set. (Contributed by Jeff Hankins, 4-Dec-2009.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.content: Any number greater than an infimum is greater than some element of the set. (Contributed by Jeff Hankins, 29-Sep-2013.) (Revised by AV, 10-Oct-2021.)

thm gtinf(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(w3a(wss(c0, cr), wne(c0, emptycls), wrex(s0, cr, wral(s1, c0, wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(s1))))), wa(wcel(c1, cr), wbr(cinf(c0, cr, clt), clt, c1))), wrex(s2, c0, wbr(cv(s2), clt, c1)))

  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s2, c0)
  -| diffsc(s2, c1)
} = {
  mp2and(wa(w3a(wss(c0, cr), wne(c0, emptycls), wrex(s0, cr, wral(s1, c0, wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(s1))))), wa(wcel(c1, cr), wbr(cinf(c0, cr, clt), clt, c1))), wrex(s2, c0, wbr(cv(s2), clt, c1)), wcel(c1, cr), wbr(cinf(c0, cr, clt), clt, c1))

  infglb(s2, s0, s1, c1, cr, c0, clt, wa(w3a(wss(c0, cr), wne(c0, emptycls), wrex(s0, cr, wral(s1, c0, wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(s1))))), wa(wcel(c1, cr), wbr(cinf(c0, cr, clt), clt, c1))))
  a1i(wa(w3a(wss(c0, cr), wne(c0, emptycls), wrex(s0, cr, wral(s1, c0, wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(s1))))), wa(wcel(c1, cr), wbr(cinf(c0, cr, clt), clt, c1))), wor(clt, cr))
  ltso()
  adantr(w3a(wss(c0, cr), wne(c0, emptycls), wrex(s0, cr, wral(s1, c0, wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(s1))))), wa(wcel(c1, cr), wbr(cinf(c0, cr, clt), clt, c1)), wrex(s0, cr, wa(wral(s1, c0, wn(wbr(cv(s1), clt, cv(s0)))), wral(s1, cr, wi(wbr(cv(s0), clt, cv(s1)), wrex(s2, c0, wbr(cv(s2), clt, cv(s1))))))))

thm gtinf(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ (((c0 ⊆ ℝ ∧ c0 ≠ ∅ ∧ ∃(s0 ∈ ℝ, ∀(s1 ∈ c0, s0[≤]s1)))∧(c1 ∈ ℝ ∧ inf(c0, ℝ, <)[<]c1))→ ∃(s2 ∈ c0, s2[<]c1))
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, s2)
  ⊣ d(s1, s2)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
  ⊣ d(s2, c0)
  ⊣ d(s2, c1)
} = {
  mp2and(((c0 ⊆ ℝ ∧ c0 ≠ ∅ ∧ ∃(s0 ∈ ℝ, ∀(s1 ∈ c0, s0[≤]s1)))∧(c1 ∈ ℝ ∧ inf(c0, ℝ, <)[<]c1)), ∃(s2 ∈ c0, s2[<]c1), c1 ∈ ℝ, inf(c0, ℝ, <)[<]c1)
  simprl((c0 ⊆ ℝ ∧ c0 ≠ ∅ ∧ ∃(s0 ∈ ℝ, ∀(s1 ∈ c0, s0[≤]s1))), c1 ∈ ℝ, inf(c0, ℝ, <)[<]c1)
  simprr((c0 ⊆ ℝ ∧ c0 ≠ ∅ ∧ ∃(s0 ∈ ℝ, ∀(s1 ∈ c0, s0[≤]s1))), c1 ∈ ℝ, inf(c0, ℝ, <)[<]c1)
  infglb(s2, s0, s1, c1, cr, c0, clt, ((c0 ⊆ ℝ ∧ c0 ≠ ∅ ∧ ∃(s0 ∈ ℝ, ∀(s1 ∈ c0, s0[≤]s1)))∧(c1 ∈ ℝ ∧ inf(c0, ℝ, <)[<]c1)))
  a1i(((c0 ⊆ ℝ ∧ c0 ≠ ∅ ∧ ∃(s0 ∈ ℝ, ∀(s1 ∈ c0, s0[≤]s1)))∧(c1 ∈ ℝ ∧ inf(c0, ℝ, <)[<]c1)), < ≺ ℝ)
  ltso()
  adantr((c0 ⊆ ℝ ∧ c0 ≠ ∅ ∧ ∃(s0 ∈ ℝ, ∀(s1 ∈ c0, s0[≤]s1))), (c1 ∈ ℝ ∧ inf(c0, ℝ, <)[<]c1), ∃(s0 ∈ ℝ,(∀(s1 ∈ c0, ¬ s1[<]s0)∧ ∀(s1 ∈ ℝ,(s0[<]s1 → ∃(s2 ∈ c0, s2[<]s1))))))

  diff.cr.s(s1)
  diff.clt.s(s1)

  diff.w3a.s(s2, c0 ⊆ ℝ, c0 ≠ ∅, ∃(s0 ∈ ℝ, ∀(s1 ∈ c0, s0[≤]s1)))
  diff.wss.s(s2, c0, cr)
  diff.wne.s(s2, c0, emptycls)
  diff.emptycls.s(s2)

  diff.wral.s(s2, s1, c0, s0[≤]s1)

blocks.name: opnrebl2
blocks.content: A set is open in the standard topology of the reals precisely when every point can be enclosed in an arbitrarily small ball. (Contributed by Jeff Hankins, 22-Sep-2013.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 30-Jan-2014.)

blocks.name: nn0prpwlem
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ nn0prpw . Use strong induction to show that every positive integer has unique prime power divisors. (Contributed by Jeff Hankins, 28-Sep-2013.)

blocks.name: nn0prpw
blocks.content: Two nonnegative integers are the same if and only if they are divisible by the same prime powers. (Contributed by Jeff Hankins, 29-Sep-2013.)
blocks.origin:
